markdown.markdown:
:::::: course-block ::: course-title ECON 3023: Intermediate Macroeconomics ::: ::: course-info **Semester:** Summer 2025\ **Instructor:** Graham Lewis :::

Determinants of national income, employment, and price level; effects of monetary and fiscal policies; emphasis on a general equilibrium approach.

::: course-materials
Lecture Slides - [Lecture 1 - Introduction](lectures/lecture1_Introduction.pdf){target="_blank"} - [Lecture 2 - Production](lectures/lecture2_Production.pdf){target="_blank"} - [Lecture 3 - Solow](lectures/lecture3_Solow.pdf){target="_blank"} - [Lecture 4 - Ideas](lectures/lecture4_Ideas.pdf){target="_blank"} - [Lecture 5 - Beyond Physical Capital](lectures/lecture5_expandingCapital.pdf){target="_blank"} - [Lecture 6 - Human Capital](lectures/lecture6_HumanCapital.pdf){target="_blank"} - [Lecture 7 - Unmeasured Capital](lectures/lecture7_UnmeasuredCapital.pdf){target="_blank"} - [Lecture 8 - Labor Supply](lectures/lecture8_LaborSupply.pdf){target="_blank"} - [Lecture 9 - Taxes](lectures/lecture9_Taxes.pdf){target="_blank"}
Homework Assignments️ - [HW 1 – Production and Solow](homeworks/hw1.pdf){target="_blank"} - [HW 2 – Romer and Human Capital](homeworks/hw2.pdf){target="_blank"} - [HW 3 – Unmeasured Capital and Labor Supply](homeworks/hw3.pdf){target="_blank"}
::: ::::::
:::::: course-block ::: course-title ECON 3023, 3024: Intermediate Macroeconomics ::: ::: course-info Semester: Spring 2025, Fall 2024 ::: ::: course-info University of Minnesota (Head TA) :::

Determinants of national income, employment, and price level; effects of monetary and fiscal policies; emphasis on a general equilibrium approach.

::::::
:::::: course-block ::: course-title ECON 3011, 3012: Intermediate Microeconomics ::: ::: course-info Semester: Fall 2024, Summer 2024 ::: ::: course-info University of Minnesota (TA) :::

Behavior of households, firms, and industries under competitive/monopolistic conditions.

::::::
:::::: course-block ::: course-title ECON 1102: Principles of Macroeconomics ::: ::: course-info Semester: Spring 2024 ::: ::: course-info University of Minnesota (TA) :::

Aggregate consumption, saving, investment, and national income. Role of money, banking, and business cycles in domestic and world economy.

::::::
:::::: course-block ::: course-title ECON 1101: Principles of Microeconomics ::: ::: course-info Semester: Fall 2023 ::: ::: course-info University of Minnesota (TA) :::

Microeconomic behavior of consumers, firms, and markets in domestic and world economy

::::::
:::::: course-block ::: course-title MATH 2552: Differential Equations ::: ::: course-info Semester: Fall 2022 ::: ::: course-info Georgia Tech (TA) :::

Methods for obtaining numerical and analytic solutions of elementary differential equations. Applications are also discussed with an emphasis on modeling.

::::::
:::::: course-block ::: course-title MATH 2550: Introduction to Multivariable Calculus ::: ::: course-info Semester: Spring 2022 ::: ::: course-info Georgia Tech (TA) :::

An introduction to multivariable calculus through vectors in 3D, curves, functions of several variables, partial derivatives, min/max problems, multiple integration.

::::::
